thread.title: Anti-Brexit protesters at Monument say people have 'changed their minds' on leaving the EU

author: Laura Hill
title: Anti-Brexit protesters at Monument say people have 'changed their minds' on leaving the EU
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Anti-Brexit protesters chanted ‘EU we love you’ at a rally in Newcastle city centre on Saturday. 
Former Green Party leader Natalie Bennett and Lib Dem former leader of Newcastle City Council Lord Shipley spoke to the gathered crowd at Grey’s Monument. 
Some passers-by chanted ‘leave’ as they walked past the Brexit opponents however the protesters stood firm. 
Judith Robson, from Sunderland, works in HR and became a campaigner for the EU last year. 
She said: “I firmly believe that Britain is better in Europe it’s the foundation of economy, our society and politics and I have been brought up with certain values that are now being compromised and I don’t want to live in this type of society that is full of xenophobia and racism. 
“I think the whole decision was based on a pack of lies.” North East for Europe in Newcastle (Image: LHR) 
Frank Hindle, a former Gateshead councillor, said the North East is very dependent on trade with Europe. 
He also said that many of those who voted to leave have now changed their mind. 
Across the region 58% of people voted to leave the EU. 
Frank said: “That was the case a year and a bit ago but some people have changed their minds and I think that people should have a chance to have their say on the final deal when they know what it is.” North East for Europe in Newcastle (Image: LHR) 
Newcastle councillor Greg Stone, on behalf of the NE4EU organising group, said: “The Brexit negotiations are not going well and it is dawning on the public that the country voted to Leave on a false prospectus that will damage our country’s economy, public services, and international standing. 
“Important regional business organisations are privately in despair at the Government’s handling of Brexit and are aghast at the implications for the region’s economy. 
“We have seen a positive and enthusiastic turnout at rallies in Newcastle and we reject Theresa May’s claim that the UK has never been comfortable as a member of the EU. 
“More and more people are realising that Brexit is bad for Britain. 
“History will judge politicians harshly if they continue be complicit with what is clearly becoming a busted flush. There is still time to change direction and support an exit from Brexit.” Like us on Facebook
